bow: the great diaper debate ok guys my wife and are going to have baby real soon and we ve figured out just about everything as much as we can haha except the diaper situation we re pretty torn on going cloth or disposable we like that cloth are cheaper and we can use them for future kids but we re worried about the extra work and how it will go with the kid in day care in the future from what we ve read the environmental factor is significant since the water used to wash the cloth diapers mostly off sets the lack of land fill with disposable so the benefit would mostly be the cost difference thoughts the biggest factor was could wash load of these bad boys each day while yes we did cloth and it was great while no we did paper and it was great daycare should be just fine with cloth diapers just provide enough cleans and place for them to store the dirties and send them home one thing not mentioned often is portability when out and about at friend place the mall etc your baby poops and now you have to dump diaper in one of these locations and then cart home the cloth in plastic baggie to be washed at home actually you would also do this with pee diaper so it going to happen lot now you ve just added plastic baggie to the landfill unless you want to also wash plastic bags to be re used and that adds to the work involved as well the alternative is using hard plastic container like an empty wipes bin to carry home the dirty diapers but that takes up huge amount of space in your already full baby bag ultimately it more preference thing if you can stand handling poop amp pee directly with your hands then either one is an option but by the end of diapering your child you ll have wayyyy too much of that no matter which method you choose in case it helps ll tell you about my experience spent 150 on full set of alva cloth diapers and additional inserts this is lower cost cloth brand that uses shell and liner the major brands can cost much more with many modern cloth diapers it comes in parts and you can change out just the insert just like pad if there is little pee or poo stain but did get on the whole thing washing it is very easy especially before like months and the breastmilk formula poo just dissolves in the wash as they get older and eat food you have to remove large poos before washing the diaper sprayer device is popular but we never had one anyway it was easy to do the first few months but then our baby started being more active went back to work part time and caregivers both our relatives and babysitters did like non disposables at all many refused or did treat them properly and when we switched to part time daycare cloth was banned basically everywhere we asked around us think more expensive daycares accept it but we had certain budget so we abandoned it completely around year wish we would have stuck with it more because cloth kids tend to potty train faster still think we saved little for using cloth when we did baby is on the way and we will use these again as long as convenient may try cloth with but with it hard enough just to figure out life with baby there is so much output early on daycare changes them every hours no matter what and will go off schedule if the see hear obv poop that cloth things would have to send day plus more at home maybe keep an eye out for used lot of cloth diapers online see them quite often in great condition once you are used to having baby you could give it shot also can barely keep up with laundry for myself and my husband and baby vomit let alone add daily diaper wash right now at least when we did cloth carried smallish wet bag we had enough and did frequent enough washes that it was big deal you washed every day may ask why we did cloth until we started solids my husband and both really liked it for new baby feel like there was less irritation less garbage and it gave the baby nice fat bum handle to grip onto the washing was not super big deal at the time since it was easy to do while babywearing which is pretty much all did before my son was months got all of our prefolds used at about half price was able to sell them for the same cost we switched to disposables when we started solids and increased my office days did want to bring load of poop diapers that needed to be rinsed back home at the end of the day my son also blazed through the sizes and it gets harder to find larger used diapers in good condition so the cost savings aspect was not as big factor as we were hoping it might be definitely give it shot if you re interested just do spend crazy amount of money or stockpile until you know you re sticking with it we use mix of both cloth and disposables which is another option to consider cloth is our regular day to day diaper and our daycare has no problem using them and would say the pros for cloth are environmental factors argue it still significant less diaper rash in my experience better containment less blowouts there little to no cost savings for us because we pay for service works well for us but has it own pros and cons of course we use disposables for overnight and longer outings during the day to avoid lugging around dirty cloth diapers also weirdly when grandma looks after our kid she uses disposables because she ca figure out our cloth diapers despite having cloth diapered her own two babies go figure second starting with disposables while getting used to life with newborn why is everyone washing daily also the more often daycare changes diapers the more economical cloth becomes buying used is awesome so much cheaper and your baby is quite literally going to poop on them anyway we tried cloth but it was never ending cycle of troubleshooting preferred all in ones cause they re less to deal with laundry wise but we get random leaks so unless we tried whole batch of different diaper we could know for sure what the problem was cause the leaks happened at unpredictable times then she developed an umbilical hernia so disposables fit much better and sold my cloth ve known lots of families who did cloth at home and disposables when they were out this was great option for our family as well it not all or nothing you can do both and in the end if you do use cloth often enough to feel you ve really gotten the investment out of it you can sell them for at least half as much as you paid for them cloth is easy as long as you have wash plan which is pretty simple have 50 diapers mostly alvas so like piece and wash times week so it is really any extra work did disposables the first months and in my opinion cloth is easier because your baby does poop on clothes and themselves really we needed bath because of explosive poop regularly in disposables still do when we use them on vacation and we have only had poop leak once in cloth wet bags are what you use to take care of dirty diapers when out they take up no space and are nice to have even with disposable for gross clothes and stuff wanted to ask if it was typo that caregivers did like disposable or cloth daycare banned disposable diapers check out clothdiaps and http www fluffloveuniversity com the water vs landfill is not valid comparison for eco factor the cost of plastic diapers vs soap+water+cloth diapers is still enormous we have done mix for both of our kids we love love love our alvas but disposable is better for babysitters and travel our washer is good so they clean up pretty easily and then we just hang them to dry maybe start with small stash of cheaper cloth and try the different kinds to see which you prefer aio ai2 covers etc to maintain the routine and supply because poop stains if you do or it did if did it reads like typo like disposable is ok but cloth is high end daycare wise environmentally friendly disposables we used earth best we subscribed through amazon mom to save money they also seemed to irritate my daughter less than pampers our go to grab at the convenience store if we ran out we tried cloth diapers but my son constantly broke out with rash even without soiling them we tried different types of cloth diapers but in the end figured it was worth the hassle and switched to disposable no rash since and cloth was little bit of hassle which is why most go with disposables if they pooped you had to empty it into the toilet sometimes using squirt bottle to get the sticky bits then they all went through the washer by themselves but first they had to go through pre rinse before regular washing cycle then the added laundry to be folded and put away if you want to cloth out in public then you have to bring wet bag to haul them all back home biggest drawback of disposables is that it gets pretty expensive sometimes you can find some used at thrift stores or on local buy sell trade groups try that first before investing in new ones environmentally they are still better yes you are using water to clean them but water is used in the creation of each disposable think using water in terms of washing is better than diaper taking longer to decompose in landfill water is more renewable to me than landfill if you can afford getting all in ones that will save so much time but have all sorts of different kinds of cloth that the work too me is worth the savings even when it gets to solid food poop we use diaper spray and think it is totally worth it as for daycares where live they will use cloth if you provide it but still have to pay for the cost of diapers wipes only day for our place it really just depends and ask around now if it will impact your decision oh do have typo corrected it now meant non disposables daycares banned cloth diapers have cloth and disposable cloth ones are in garbage bag in the closet the mess the smell and the inconvenience just are worth it to me gave it fair shot disposables are great use store brand or luvs during the day saves money and pampers during the night since they re more absorbent and higher quality will second both those resources really helpful places cloth during the day works really well for us we use prefolds covers on weekends and pockets at daycare we use disposables at night because she sleeps longer in them we wash every other day sometimes every third day toilet sprayer is helpful tool once solids start use both cloth go on during the day she wears disposable diaper at night or when we re travelling visiting friends whatever have not noticed mess or smell with my cloth diapers they re one extra load of laundry do every two days and it not that difficult toss em in the dryer and reset them put the liner back in them and that pretty much it drop em in drawer once get back into the nursery love my cloth diapers eta use fuzzibunz they re pocket diapers that grow with your little one from birth til potty training removed ve never worked for daycare that was allowed by the state licensing board to keep cloth diapers on property wanted to do cloth but ended up with disposable because of convenience and ease we were living in the uk when girl1 was born and while we had combo washer tumble dryer the dryer was rubbish so we hung up all of our clothes to dry and the barrel was small so we were doing laundry every day or every other day adding in another person plus her diapers was just not going to work for us with disposables it was no muss no fuss we got lucky with pampers swaddlers and wipes and will be doing the same for girl2 who will be here within the next weeks they do get expensive we pay about 33 box and for our almost year old who refuses to potty train box lasts about month but it worth it for the ease and simplicity of them our son was home all day with my husband every day until he was and then started preschool days week for hours day until he was we did cloth no problem and liked it lot once he started preschool where they did not allow cloth we found it much more difficult to do cloth at home too we did ever have enough diapers for full load when we needed to run the wash but you ca just have dirty diapers sitting around for days on end so for us it was worth it to continue cloth during the time he was home would just factor in that sort of thing when figuring it out in my experience only the super pricey daycares accept them we checked out nearly all the daycares around us and only the crazy expensive montessori center accepted them none of the others even accepted kids that wore them worked for primrose for while and they re pretty much the top of the line pretty sure it state licensing thing to be honest keeping contained fecal matter is biohazard the major environmental problem with cloth diapers is actually from growing and processing cotton the water used to clean them is pretty negligible comparatively the processing is what usually ends up making it an environmental wash financially you might save little bit overall on cloth there are lot of reviews about this online depends on costs of water electricity gas in your location and how much you have to wash read about one woman who was washing each load 3x do remember why exactly but it sounded insane to me because the environmental impact is similar and the financial savings were not extreme and also factoring in convenience we are going with disposables also because we used the amazon baby registry and have amazon prime and our friends family purchased over certain dollar amount from our registry we got 200 in free diapers from amazon maybe 250 ca quite remember ended up spending on almost 1000 diapers have lots of extra time and energy to deal with poop do mind destroying washers dryers sinks and tubs with poop everywhere all the time ca imagine cloth diapers if you can afford not to the benefits are nonexistent and you wo see someone with more than one baby in diapers use them novelty for the west wash load of diapers every days use prefolds and snappi with covers dont care about poop stains and if they are really bad hanging them in the sun and it gets them out use tide original powder as it works best if you have any weird issues like ammonia buildup it goes warm rinse hot wash cold rinse warm rinse dry on high heat hang covers to dry eta dont find it much extra work since kids mean tons of laundry anyway parenting is hard enough make it easier get pampers and diaper genie did some research and almost went with cloth but ended up using disposables according to my research which was years ago assuming you re buying new cloth will certainly be financially worth it if you use them with more than one child there was good chance we only have one of course you can buy used and resell which offsets costs environmentally cloth is better if you air dry them if you use tumble drier it about comes out even this goes against what others have said in the comments and ca cite sources right now so recommend checking this because these factors did indicate huge advantage in our case and we do have good support network where we live we decided to go the easy route know quite few people who manage to use cloth diapers and love them so interesting because every time put cloth diaper on my kid he had diaper rash in like day there were other reasons they really did really work for us but this was the thing that killed my motivation to keep trying after times of doing cloth getting rash switching back until he healed and going back all my props to people who can make it work though hate all the and trash all going down the bin with the disposables me too with the rash agree to keep your options open according to circumstance babies poop with great variation in frequency mine was 10 15 day pooper never understood the heavy nappy thing ie how you tell if nappy is full or not when there only invisible urine it it because all of my baby nappies were brown or yellow the poop rainbow of newborn so for me disposables were life saver laundering 10 15 cloth day would have been miserable drudge did look into compostables which to my mind are even more eco friendly than cloth but you need commercial nappy composting service in your area and there was one in ours hey all the best for your upcoming arrival just to add have read some comments but not all but you can do both even if you just use one cloth diaper week that is saving 52 year from the landfill really wanted to do reusable diapers but had bad traumatic birth long recovery and live in an apartment building with basement laundry room it just was feasible in that instance if you do disposables recommend you subscribe with amazon family they come to you no running out no last minute store trips and personally could beat the price locally unless costco had sale whatever you choose suggest having couple of the alternative in the house you ll run out of disposables at during snowstorm or you ll realize you used the last of the cloth and need to finish other loads of laundry in order to even get to the diapers will say that cloth wipes are fantastic esp for newborns with the tarry poop warm water on flannel is all you need maybe some awesome diaper prints can help make up your mind just got these them check out elimination communication our son is year and we usually only use three diapers day now use cloth am on kid it can be pain sometimes and we have taken brief breaks when we used disposables for week or two we also use disposables for the first month or two after the baby is born stay home but have not had an issue with preschool or the daycares that interviewed am even still using some diapers that used on my oldest some have worn out used disposable with my daughter this was mainly because thought it would be time consuming washing them and keeping up on that ve been single mom since day constantly working trying to make ends meet and when was home just wanted to spend that time with her instead of washing diapers that being said if the situation was different probably would ve at least given cloth try if it does work out you can always make the switch to disposable it does hurt that found this etsy store that sales super adorable geeky themed cloth diapers it called seamsgeeky if you re into that sort of thing btw but yeah if it concern of yours probably buy few cloth and see how it works out and if you do like it just switch to disposable there no rule stating you have to stick to one lol wat destroyed washers not used on more than one baby pretty sure that was all of the entire world like 50 years ago east or west just wash every three days have had undue issues with poop staining but scrape dump as soon as the poop occurs was really surprised to hear people wash every day because where live most people wash every or days although some people try to stretch it longer will admit did buy extra diapers so would have to wash as often but given how long it takes to do the diaper wash never be able to do other laundry if washed them every day there re few possible variables machine detergents water quality diaper brand but consistently if forgot to wash poop could count on there being stain ca comment on the daycare situation but we did disposables for month could stand them cloth was so easy even with the washing so quick to put away just put the inserts in pile and the covers in pile in his drawer even traveling had no issues have about 30 bumgenius 0s with hempbabies inserts for overnights wash about every days made my own cloth wipes from flannel all you need is to wet them with warm water we only use diapers overnight now did elimination communication and my son was daytime potty trained just after years old really think the cloth diapers helped with that smile to myself when see people in line at the store with 70 worth of disposables ca even imagine random question have you tried an all hobf diaper for night ve heard they re amazing with absorbtion know multiple people with two that cloth diaper my best friend is about to pop with twins and fully intends to cloth diaper after cloth diapering two singletons before with it not sure what and hobf diaper is heavy organic bamboo fiber suppose to be super absorbent know ton of moms that use it for over night well that and fleece made diapers we found day care before we decided on diapers and our daycare will only do disposables so that was that plus we re only having one kid so the cost difference is that big and at this point in our lives we have more money than time ve definitely heard both my own experience has been that cloth gives my kid less rash but of course ymmv why do they do that an excess or lack of money an excess of time why overcomplicate your life for no benefit to the child or environment it makes absolutely no sense it actually can benefit the child cloth is more breathable so causes less rashes some kids are allergic to the chemicals used in sposies so cloth is the only choice because you can control the detergent used my friend makes the diapers for living so it makes sense to use her own product yes they can be bit pricey but the people who pay for the pricier ones have the money to do so they appreciate their little one having cute bum it choice just like breastfeeding vs ff feeding you do what is best and what works for your family did what had to do for my family cded two disposables at daycare even at night used wool covers my last one though his skin is soooo sensitive he got yeast infection as newborn that was so bad that the first rx cream did fix it had to get something stronger once got that cleared up tried cloth again and his rash came roaring back in like hours took break from cloth and his rash never came back months later tried cloth again and his rash was so awful that puss filled blisters formed sacrificing my baby health was worth it had gotten my money worth with the first two using cloth and honestly with boys ca handle more laundry
